attributes.comment:
As an individual adopting internationally, I have to tell you that
this proposed increase will significantly increase the financial hardship incurred by
adoptive parents. If this increase was a single occurance it would not seem
extreme, but with most international adoptions taking longer than the time an
I171H and fingerprints are valid most families would need to pay these fees two or
more times.

Having to pay for processing of fingerprints and a second I600A is bad enough
without adding the additional fees on top.

If this proposed change is adopted I would strongly suggest making changes to
the number of months that adoption fingerprints and the I171H are valid to bring
them more in line with referal wait times for international adoption. It is a hard pill
to swallow when this increased financial hardship is thrust upon adoptive families
by the US directly caused by our US government itself.

If you have taken the time to read and consider my comments, I thank
you deeply. My concern is much deeper than this, and I hope that you
will not increase such fees, but if you do that the time to expiration will increase.
attributes.title: Comment Submitted By Anonymous
